Entries.default:
"I can't believe that old bastard tricked me. I feel like the gods' own fool."

Audr fidgets with a well-worn bracelet around her wrist, her eyes unfocused and distant.
"Would you like to join my crew?"
"Take some coin and my well-wishes. I'm sure you'll find your way."
"Don't ask me. You're on your own."
"I would be honored. I owe you my life, after all - it's the least I could do."

"That's awfully generous of you. Thank you for... for everything."

Audr stuffs your coins in her pockets and hurries off, casting frequent looks at you over her shoulder.
"Aren't we all. Thank you, stranger, for intervening when you did. I owe you a life debt I can't ever repay." She gives you a quick, curt nod and hurries off.
"I left my Wifruth, my home, my life. What- what do I do now?" She turns round, frightened eyes on you and hastily dashes away her tears.
"I'll meet you back on the ship, captain!" She throws you a hearty wink and a gap-toothed grin, then hurries off.
